gurmukhi: iqn kI bqIXw suin kY pRB jU igr kMau sMig pwien ky mskXo ] n skXo sh Bwr suqw pg ko kib sXwm BnY jl lau DiskXo ]
transliteration: Tin Kibateeyaa Soun(i) Kai Prabh Joo Gir Kaoun San(i) Paain Ke Maskyo|| Na Sakyo Sah Bhaar Soutaa Pag Ko Kabi Syaam Bhanai Jal Lau Dhas(i)kyo||
translation: Hearing their talk, the Lord pressed the mountain with his feet, and the mountain could not endure his weight and sank below like water;

gurmukhi: auskXo igr aUrD ko Dis kY koaU pwvk jIv jrw n skXo ] jdubIr hlI iqh sYn mY kUd pro nih Xw iqn kO kiskXo ]1937]
transliteration: Ouskyo Gir Ooradh Ko Dhas(i) Kai Ko( i)  Paavak Jeev Jaraa Na Sakyo|| Jadoubeer Halitih Sain Mai Kood Daro Nah(i) Yaa Tin Kau Kas(i)kyo||1937||
translation: After sinking below, the mountain rose higher and in this way, the fire could not burn anyone; at the same time, Krishna and Balram jumped silently into the enemy’s army.1937.

gurmukhi: eykh hwQ gdw gih sXwm jU BUpq ky bhuqy Bt mwry ] Aaur Gny Asvwr hny ibn pRwn Gny gij kY BUA pwry ]
transliteration: Ekah Haath Gadaa Gadh Syaam Joo Bhoopat Ke Bahoute Bhat Mdare|| Aur Ghane Asvaar Hane Bin Praan Ghane Gad(i) Kai Bhooa Pdare||
translation: Holding his mace in his hand, Krishna killed many warriors of the king; he killed many horsemen and knocked them on the ground;

gurmukhi: pwien pMq hnY Agny rQ qor rQI ibrQI kr fwry ] jIq BhI jdubIr kIXo kib sXwm khY sB XoN Ar hwry ]1938]
transliteration: Paain Pant Hanai Agne Rath To Rothibirthikar Ddare|| Jeet Bhahijadoubeer Keeyo Kabi Syaam Kahai Sabh Yon At Hdare||1938||
translation: He destroyed the ranks of soldiers on foot and deprived the chariot-riders of their chariots; in this way, killing all the warriors, Krishna became victorious and the enemy was defeated.1938.

gurmukhi: jo Bt sXwm so jUJ ky Awvq jUJq hY su lgy Bt BIr n ] sRI biRjnwQ ky qyj ky AgR khY kib sXwm DrY koaU DIr n ]
transliteration: Jo Bhat Syaam So Jeeth Ke Aavat Joojhat Hai Su Lage Bhat Beerna|| Sribrijnaath Ke Tej Ke Agra Kahai Kabi Syaam Ddarai Ko( i)  Dheer Na||
translation: The warriors who came to fight with Krishna, they fought with extreme zest; the poet Shyam says that before the strength of Krishna. No warrior can hold patience.

gurmukhi: BUpq dyK dSw iqn kI su kihE ieh BwNiq BXo Aiq hI rn ] mwno qMbolI hI kI sm hÍY niRp pwnn kI ijm bIrin ]1939]
transliteration: Bhoopat Dekh Dashaa Tin Kisu Kahio Eh Bhaant(i) Bhayo At(i) Hiran|| Maano Tanbolihikisam Gvai Nrip Phehat Paanan Kijim Bderan(i)||1939||
translation: Seeing the plight of the warriors in the war-arena, the king Uggarsain said, “The king Jarasandh is like betel, who is destroying his army like the chewing of the betel.1939.

gurmukhi: ieq kop gdw gih kY muslIDr SqRn sYn Bly JkJorXo ] jo Bt Awie iBry smuhy iqh eyk cpytih so isr qorXo ]
transliteration: It Kop Gadaa Gadh Kai Mousleedhar Shatran Sain Bhale Jhakjhoryo|| Jo Bhat Aae Bhire Samuhe Tih Ek Chapetah(i) So Sir Toryo||
translation: On this side, Balram taking his mace in his hand in rage, shook violently the enemy’s army and the warrior who confronted him, he broke his head even with one slep;

gurmukhi: Aaur ijqI cqurMg cmUM iqn ko muK AYsI hI BwNq so morXo ] jIq ley sB hI Airvw iqn qo AijiqE Bt eyk n CorXo ]1940]
transliteration: Aur Jitichaturan Chamoond Tin Ko Moukh Aisihibhaant So Moryo|| Jeet Lae Sabh Hiar(i)vaa Tin To Ajitio Bhat Ek Na Chhodhyo||1940||
translation: He defeated all the remaining enemy’s army and became completely victorious.1940.

gurmukhi: kwnH hlI imil BRwq duhUM jb sYn sBY iqh BUp ko mwrXo ] so koaU jIq bcXo iqh qy ijm dwNqn Gws gihE blu hwrXo ]
transliteration: Kaahn Halimil(i) Bhraat Duhoon Jab Sain Sabhai Tih Bhoop Ko Mdaryo|| So Ko( i)  Jeet Badhyo Tih Te Jim Saantan Ghaas Gadio Bal(u) Hdaryo||
translation: When both the brothers Krishna and Balram together killed the whole army of the enemy, then only that person could save himself, who putting the grass-straws in his mouth, came under their refuge;

gurmukhi: AYsI dSw jb BI dl kI qb BUpq Awpny nYn inhwrXo ] jIq Aau jIv kI Aws qjI hT Twnq BXo purKq sMBwrXo ]1941]
transliteration: Aisidashaa Jab Bhidal Kitab Bhoopat Aapane Nain Nihdaryo|| Jiau Jeev Kiaas Tajihath Thaanat Bhayo Purkhat Sanbhdaryo||1941||
translation: When Jarasandh saw this plight with his own eyes, then abandoning the hope of victory and life, he also persistently managed to upkeep his bravery in war.1941.
